arts.ttl: Sporting 2-0 Rio Ave: Lions take a step closer to Jamor
arts.sum: Sporting beat Rio Ave 2-0 at Alvalade tonight in the first leg of the Portuguese Cup semi-final. First-half goals by Geny Catamo and Viktor Gyökeres (penalty) put the hosts firmly in control of the tie. The Lisbon club will be wondering how they did not score more in the second half after Gyökeres hit the post, Catamo had the ball in the net only to see it ruled out for a narrow offside, and chance after chance went begging. Rio Ave are still alive in the competition but will need a huge improvement in the second leg, played in Vila do Conde on 22 April, to have a chance of turning around the result.

arts.ttl: Rui Borges faz rotação na equipa. Eis o onze do Sporting ante o Rio Ave
arts.sum: Confira as escolhas iniciais de Rui Borges e Petit.

arts.sum: Mixed injury news in win over Fulham sums up Arsenal’s season The win against Fulham on Tuesday perfectly encapsulated Arsenal’s season. You had the positive of Bukayo Saka coming back, something that boosted the whole club. And then you had the crushing disappointment of seeing Gabriel Magalhaes limp off early with a hamstring injury. arts.ttl: Viktor Gyokeres draws up list of seven clubs he wants to join as Man Utd suffer huge blow
arts.sum: The future of Sporting Lisbon striker Viktor Gyokeres is set to be one of the biggest stories of the summer transfer window, with Manchester United among the clubs linked with signing him
